data.title: Building with TDM-gcc
[Linux] Backspace/cursor behavior odd?
data.body:
I don't know if this is a wxGtk bug or something specific with my system, but reporting anyway.

How to reproduce:
1. Click on any text box. Whether it's in the properties, the search box in the "edit the condition" window, or even in the bug reporter doesn't seem to matter.
2. Type some text.
3. Press backspace.

What happens for me: nothing happens. No text is removed.
1. Press left or right.

What happens for me: again, nothing happens. The cursor's position doesn't change.

Strangely enough, if I press backspace or the arrow keys, minimize GDevelop and then unminimize it, it seems to have performed the backspace/cursor movement actions correctly. For some reason, it is just not doing it properly immediately.

Xubuntu 15.04/Xfce/GDevelop from the official PPA

data.title: Tiled sprite always displaying as "invalid image"
data.body:
For some reason, no matter what picture I use, the tiled sprite always seems to think they're an invalid image:
![2015-07-23-130127_1502x926_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/105533/8848848/14a9fa9e-313b-11e5-8c8c-ab8ca3b3c0fc.png)

I tested with the following images, but it seems to do this with any:

![grasstile](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/105533/8848833/f64ef63a-313a-11e5-9617-9e5653dfa084.png) 
![trobbletest](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/105533/8848993/489ce7ca-313c-11e5-8308-311bc397a7aa.png) 
![testpic](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/105533/8848998/4eea4c6c-313c-11e5-9c85-4d22a2fcdc2e.png)

Using Ubuntu 15.04 and the PPA release. This is a new, unsaved HTML5 project with files from several different paths.

data.title: [Linux] GDevelop crashes when quitting with ctrl+Q
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Start GDevelop.
2. Make a new empty project.
3. Left-click anywhere on the scene.
4. Press ctrl+Q to close GDevelop.

GDevelop segfaults when I do this and comes with the error reporter next time I launch it.

Terminal output:

```
(...)
* Initialization ended.
Sending analytics data...done (201)

(GDIDE:26293): Gtk-CRITICAL **: IA__gtk_window_resize: assertion 'width > 0' failed
Sending analytics data...done (201)

(GDIDE:26293): Gtk-CRITICAL **: IA__gtk_widget_set_size_request: assertion 'width >= -1' failed

(GDIDE:26293): Gtk-CRITICAL **: IA__gtk_widget_set_size_request: assertion 'width >= -1' failed
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

Using Ubuntu 15.04.

data.title: Fix TileSetConfigurationEditor crashing on Windows
data.body:
Setting the range of the spinbox to (1,0) (it's the case when there are no textures assigned to the tilemap) causes GDevelop to crash (and not on Linux on which I tested the TileMap recently).

A hotfix is needed as this bug prevents the use of the TileMapObject (only for Windows as the bug doesn't happen on Linux).

data.title: Renaming objects in external layout causes them to be invisible + more
data.body:
Renaming objects in an external layout causes them to become invisible, or act as if they don't exist.
It seems that the object name is not being updated/saved.

Note: if you rename it back to the original name (e.g. NewObject) it will show again

To reproduce:
1) New empty project
2) Add an external layout
3) Double click the new external layout to open it
4) Choose any scene to edit "as if the objects were included"
5) Make a text object or shape painter (for example)
You will see it on the screen fine,
until 6) Rename the object (in object editor) to anything else
It disappears, and doesn't render in the game either.
7) Rename it back to the original name (NewObject) and it shows again..

In addition, if you stop at Step 6 (leaving the name as something new) 
Then 
-Add another object
-It will have the same name as the first object originally did (e.g. NewObject)
And even though the original object is named something else (such as "Blah"), when editing the properties of EITHER object, it changes the values for both of them as if they are the same object.

data.title: Force GDevelop to start with the GTK x11 backend on Linux
data.body: Force GDevelop to start with the GTK x11 backend on Linux as GDevelop can't work with Wayland (uses SFML that only works with x11).

data.title: Ubuntu 32-bit not installing from repository
data.body: I installed GD on Windows 32-bit and Ubuntu 64-bit but it fails to install on Ubuntu 32-bit (Trusty) from PPA. This seems to be because the 32-bit deb is missing from the PPA.

data.title: Internet connection does not work through proxy server
data.body: At start-up, GD performs a (optional) check for updates. If this fails, a warning message pops up. This check will fail if connection to the Internet is via a proxy server. It would be advantageous to check for proxy server and / or give user option to configure one. (Some operating systems such as Windows can use a common (IE) setting for proxy server configuration.)

data.title: Crashes on close on Windows 7
data.body:
I am using the zip version (non-installer) of GD on Windows 7 Professional 64-bit. When closing GD, an error occurs, presented in a dialog: "GDevelop Integrated Development Environment has stopped working." GD version 3.6.80.0 Release.
I have seen this symptom when developing with wxWidgets when a process attempts to close a window that wxWidgets has already closed due to wxWidget's built-in destructor mechanism. This _may_ be similar.

data.title: Fix some widgets not sized correctly under GTK3/Gnome 3
data.body: Replace some wxTextCtrl/wxChoice custom height by -1 so as the widget's height is now automatic.

data.title: fix setting initial sprite size and animation in HTML5
data.body:
If you set a custom initial instance size and an animation different than 0 (initial instance properties in the scene editor), the sprite will be scaled taking account the "animation 0" size, with bad results if the animation 0 and the one you set have different ratios (in HTML5, it works fine in native).
It's the simplest way I found to fix it :smiley:

data.title: The tile size cannot be bigger than the tileset texture size anymore

It set the maximum of the spin controls to the texture width and height.
